intro: Sticherus velatus, commonly known as the velvet sticherus, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage that gives it its common name. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its structure consists of a thallus with closely packed leaves that are often arranged in a spiral pattern. Sticherus velatus plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
